page.title: 12 THE OLD RECTORY.
page.content: The rectory is a good example of 18th. century housing.Construction began in 1790 but was not completed until 1820. Originally it was part of the Earl of Shrewsbury's estate.It ceased to be used as a rectory in 1937 and during the Second World War was used by the army.For the last eight years it has been owned by Mr.J,Howells who, prior to this had rented a flat in the rectory for twenty seven years.He now looks after the six acres of land that is attached to the building. The rectory has now been converted into private flats.This has partly been done to help with the high cost of running the building. Unfortunately, this has meant that some of the interior has been changed and the old character has been lost. This does seem to be a trend that is on the increase to examples of. local history in this area.
